Detailed Description

Class Dimension is used to represent the dimension of a SAMRAI object.

The maximum dimension is set at compile time using a flag to the configure script. This is used to allocate arrays in some lower level classes such as IntVector. If dynamic memory allocation is used the performance impact is significant; a maximum dimension allows for stack based memory allocation in performance critical classes at the expense of wasting storage for objects with dimension less than the maximum dimension.

A class is used rather than a simple short or integer to provide enhanced type safety.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::Dimension ( const unsigned short &  dim  )  [explicit]

Constructor for Dimension, object is built using the specified dimension

Note that the constructor is "explicit" thus making automatic type conversions from integers impossible. This is intentionally to avoid unintended conversions.

When dimensional assertion checking is active an assert is thrown when dim < 1 or dim > getMaxDimension() value specified when the library is configured (defaults to 3). dim also cannot be the getInvalidDimension() (the largest unsigned short value).

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::Dimension ( const Dimension &  dimension  ) 

Construct a dimension equal to the argument.

Member Function Documentation

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD bool SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::isValid (  )  const

Returns true if Dimension is valid.

A valid Dimension != 0; != getInvalidDimension(), and <= getMaxDimension().

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD bool SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::isInitialized (  )  const

Returns true if Dimension is initialized (not set to getInvalidDimension()).

unsigned short SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::getValue (  )  const [inline]

Returns the dimension of the Dimension as an unsigned short.

The method is provided to allow sizing of arrays based on the dimension and for iteration. In general this should not be used for comparisons, the Dimension comparison operations are better suited for that purpose.

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD unsigned short SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::getMaxDimValue (  )  [static]

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD const Dimension & SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::getMaxDimension (  )  [static]

Returns the maximum dimension for the currently compiled library as a Dimension object.

When the SAMRAI library is compiled a maximum dimension allowed is specified (the default is 3). This method is typically used to allocate arrays.

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD const Dimension & SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::getInvalidDimension (  )  [static]

An invalid dimension value as a Dimension object.

SAMRAI_INLINE_KEYWORD unsigned short SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::getInvalidDimValue (  )  [static]

An invalid dimension value as an unsigned short.

Currently this value is numeric_limits<unsigned short>::max() but use this symbol as it is more readable.

Member Data Documentation

const unsigned short SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::MAXIMUM_DIMENSION_VALUE [static]

Initial value:

      SAMRAI_MAXIMUM_DIMENSION
Returns the maximum dimension for the currently compiled library as an unsigned short.

When the SAMRAI library is compiled a maximum dimension allowed is specified (the default is 3). This method is typically used to allocate arrays.

double array[SAMRAI::tbox::Dimension::MAXIMUM_DIMENSION_VALUE];

The value must be >= 1 and < numeric_limits<unsigned short>::max()
